Activity: Log in to the system, check emails. Respond to any urgent requests or questions from @helpdesk-1 regarding database access or performance issues. Prioritize based on impact.
Review the existing influenza database schema design document. Refresh my memory on the current table structures and relationships. Make notes on areas needing further attention.

Continue designing the tables for the influenza database schema. Focus on tables related to patient demographics and visit information. Create draft table definitions with column names and descriptions.
Research best practices for storing patient demographic data in healthcare databases. Consult online resources and documentation for guidance on data privacy and security considerations.

Continue defining data types for each column in the patient demographics and visit information tables. Consider data type appropriateness for each field (e.g., VARCHAR for names, DATE for dates, INT for numeric IDs).
Email @his-1 and @his-2 to clarify data type requirements for certain fields, particularly those involving coded data or clinical terminologies. Topic: Data Type Clarification for Influenza Database.
Document the data types chosen for each column, along with explanations for the selections. This will aid in future understanding and maintenance.
Review the table designs and data type definitions for completeness and accuracy. Identify any potential issues or inconsistencies.
Prepare for tomorrow by listing which parts of the table design still need work. Write a short to-do list and shut down my computer.
